description:
After installing it is unclear how to start the program. In the Terminal window typing 'document-imaging' generates:
warning: Could not find config file in /home/jan/snap/document-imaging/11/metadata.json
Cannot find scanner!
Like the others say, it can't be found, except to delete it again.
Apparently, this is not intended for use with scanners, since there are no instructions included to use scanners.

summary: Runs correctly once USB permissions set as expressed above !

description:
I have a Canon PIXMA multifunction device that includes scanning, copying, fax sending and printing functionality. Yet, this program does not work with my device's built-in scanner. It cannot detect it, let alone communicate with it. Instead, it gives me the following error messages:

 - "warning: Could not find config file in /home/me/snap/document-imaging/11/scanner.json"
 - "warning: Could not find config file in /home/me/snap/document-imaging/11/metadata.json"
 - "Cannot find scanner!"

One the SANE project's website, there is a page that mentions that sane-escl provides the backend driver to allow Linux to communicate with my particular scanner. (See http://sane-project.org/man/sane-escl.5.html.) There is a page in the Ubuntu manual that says that this driver is available for download in the compressed sane-escl.5.gz file that it provides a link to.
It also says that the sane-escl.5 scanner driver is available as part of the libsane-common_1.1.1-5_all library package that it provides for download in a compressed archive as well. You can find that information in the following web-page: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/jammy/en/man5/sane-escl.5.html.

Perhaps if the installer for this program could detect my scanner and install the required scanner driver automatically, this application could work properly for my device.
summary: Does not work with my scanner

description: poppt auf und ist weg, passiert nichts
mais comment faire en sorte que mon scanner marche !
